definition: To persuade someone to change their opinion or to talk their way out of a difficult situation, often by using clever arguments or explanations. This term is commonly used when referring to someone trying to convince or manipulate others through persuasive speech.

examples.english: He tried to talk his way out of it.
She skillfully talked herself out of it.

examples.german: Es ist schwer, sich aus dieser Situation herauszureden.
examples.english: It's difficult to talk your way out of this situation.
He always tries to talk his way out of things.

examples.german: Sie hat versucht, sich herauszureden, aber es hat nicht funktioniert.
examples.english: She tried to talk her way out of it, but it didn't work.
